result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 01/15/15 plea/sentencing hearing.

Defendant Abraham Nmi McCormick in court, in custody, with Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse, appearing as stand by counsel.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in.  Court dismisses and reads-in this case for Defendant's plea to Case #13CF1350.
Preliminary hearing on January 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Dodge Correctional Institution. (Per transport Defendant is to be sent to Dodge Correctional on Monday, January 12th by the Ozaukee County Sheriff)

Defendant Abraham Nmi McCormick in court, in custody, with Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse, as stand by counsel.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses motions filed by Defendant on this case as well as Case #14CF714.  State requests the court to deny all motions filed.  Defendant states he does not have any additional comments.  Court denies motions filed by Defendant. Preliminary hearing set on this case.  OTP needed from Ozaukee County jail.  (Note OTP is being prepared already for 1/15/15 jury status and 1/20/15 jury trial.  Defendant to be returned forthwith.   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Motion to dismiss: Defective Criminal Complaint. Filed by the defendant.
Motion hearing on January 8, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Motion to dismiss, Motion to suppress, Notice to object, with supporting documents filed by the Defendant.
Preliminary hearing on January 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
filed, to be produced from the Ozaukee County Jail.

Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court as stand by counsel.   Defendant Abraham Nmi McCormick did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was transferred to Ozaukee County. Court tolled the matter for cause and adjourned the matter.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Abraham Nmi McCormick in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse as stand-by counsel.   Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is requesting the court to take judicial notice of the bond in file 13CF1350. Defendant presents objects to the court. State is requesting a short adjournment for the officer to appear. Defendant objects. Court grants the state's request. Defendant requests a bail modification. State objects. Court denied.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Notice & Demand, filed by the defendant.

Preliminary hearing on November 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Abraham Nmi McCormick in court, in custody.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Defendant states he still wishes to proceed without counsel but is requesting stand by counsel.  Court advises Defendant of his right to counsel but requests stand by counsel.  Court finds Defendant is knowingly and intelligently waiving his right to counsel but will appoint stand-by counsel for Defendant.  Court sets preliminary hearing date.  Court sets cash bail.  DEFENDANT TO REMAIN IN WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.  Court orders that jail allow Defendant writing materials to prepare for his case.  Court orders Defendant be allowed 2 phone calls to try to raise bail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.
